titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album A tour of Palestine, 1903 from the Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref151
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 18:34:00 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: A Tour of Palestine, 1903 - Hisham Khatib Collection

physdesc.extent: - An album of 24 albumen photographs and one postcard.

did.physdesc: Generally good, some brittle and warped.
did.abstract:
An album of albumen photographs taken during a tour of Palestine in 1903.
The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains hundreds of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Matson photo Service, American Colony, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good. Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 3,000 images. See main collection http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/akkasah/ad_mc_030/

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: An album of 24 albumen photographs and one postcard.

Hisham Khatib Collection total - 2,930 photographs and postcards (both individual prints and contained within albums) focussed on the Near East, including the Holy Land, Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt as well as a very small number from Europe.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dr. Hisham Khatib are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains hundreds of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Matson photo Service, American Colony, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good.

Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 3,000 images.
